message: but I told you I got hurt with ribs

Hey Steve! I totally get that you hurt your ribs, and I’m here to help with what you can expect at the ED. So, when you arrive, after initial triage, a nurse will evaluate how serious your injury is. If it's urgent, you’ll be seen quicker. After that, you'll go through registration, and then it’s usually a waiting game until a doctor can examine you. They might order some tests to get a better look at what's going on before deciding on the best treatment for you. If you've got any specific parts of the process you’re curious about, just let me know!
okay so what is my injury you should recall from my previous convers

Hey Steve! I see you've hurt your ribs, and I'm here to help you with the process at the emergency department. When you arrive, a nurse will first check how serious your injury is and assign a triage level. Depending on that, you could either be seen right away or might have to wait a bit in the waiting room. After registration, a doctor will look at your injury, possibly order some tests, and then make a treatment plan. If you have more questions about what to expect or anything specific, just let me know!

Hey there! I’m Bloom, your friendly flower plant assistant here to help you with the emergency department process. If you have any questions or need to know what to expect during your visit, just ask away!

Hey Steve! Right now, you’re admitted to the hospital, and it looks like you’ve had some imaging and lab tests done, and those results are all in. You've been here for about 86 minutes, and you were classified as needing urgent care. If you have more questions or need to know what’s coming next, just let me know!
yep I want to know what's happening next

Alright, Steve! So, since you’ve already been triaged, the next step is that a doctor will come to assess your condition. They might check the test results that have come back and decide on a treatment plan for your ribs. After that, you'll either receive treatment and get ready to head home or be admitted for further care if needed. Just hang tight, and if you have more questions or need anything else, feel free to ask!
